item.description:
***** You may call the Liberty Hotel at (617) 224-4000 to confirm if the movie is cancelled
Read the last paragraph on this page to find out Plan B *****


Let's meet up at the Liberty Hotel in The Yard again for drinks and/or a movie.

FREE film with complimentary popcorn and pop chips as well as cash bar with movie candy for sale.

As always, get there when you can and stay as long or short as you're able.

The weather on past Monday evenings has been ideal to be outside and hang out in this cool setting...enjoying the company of friendly fun folks. The movie begins close to 8 PM.

The evening's film is Bottle Rocket, which is a comedy. Plot: Upon his release from a mental hospital following a nervous breakdown, the directionless Anthony joins his friend Dignan, who seems far less sane than the him. Dignan has hatched a hare-brained scheme for an as-yet-unspecified crime spree that somehow involves his former boss, the (supposedly) legendary Mr. Henry. With the help of their pathetic neighbor and pal Bob, Anthony and Dignan pull a job and hit the road, where Anthony finds love with motel maid Inez. When our boys finally hook up with Mr. Henry, the ensuing escapade turns out to be far from what anyone expected. Directed by Wes Anderson featuring brothers Luke Wilson and Owen Wilson as well as Andrew Wilson and James Caan.

Get on the guest list by emailing moviemondays@libertyhotel.com

Check out MBTA or Hop Stop to create your route by public transit. Charles/MGH (red line) is the closest subway station and steps away. Government (green & blue lines) subway station is less than a ten (10) minute walk.

PLEASE MAINTAIN YOUR OWN TAB OR PAY AS YOU ORDER - THANK YOU

If the movie is cancelled the drinking, meeting and chatting will be held in the Liberty Lobby Bar located at the top of the escalators. You'll find me playing the card game solitaire.
item.how_to_find_us: Ask the doorman at the hotel entrance to direct you to the Courtyard...find me seated nearest the screen with a deck of playing cards on a side table.
